story: Meligy shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: Gulp, Grunt, Whatever
caption: blog.ponyfoo.com

data.message: The case in the Node world is much better than it in the Ruby world for example. It didn't start this way, but Microsoft approached Node core for adding APIs to some things that package and module developers used to ask from OS directly. Once the APIs were in Node, it became a best practice to use them instead of talking to OS directly.

That's why, when someone who cares forks Yeoman or Grunt or whatever other big project and adds Windows support, although the project owners often don't care much, they often accept the pull request. Windows support has gone from not-very-miserable  when I first looked to not-bad-at-all by early-mid 2013.
